|cpu1_cores = |cpu1_type = |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = SK hynix;H9DA4GH2GJAM; |flash1size = 512 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 256 |ram1chip = SK hynix;H9DA4GH2GJAM; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_none = true |oui = F4:63:49 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = USB 2.0 (slave) |exp_sim_num = |exp_pcmcia_num = |exp_expcard_num = |exp_minipci_num = |exp_minipcie_num = |exp_usb_num = 1 |exp_cf_num = |exp_sdmmc_num = |exp_ide_num = |exp_ata_num = |exp_sata_num = |exp_esata_num = |exp_parallel = |exp_sfp_num = |exp_M.2 = |usb_hub = No |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = USB Male-A |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = CDMA,LTE |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = |defaultssid = C Spire 4G LTE Hotspot XXXX |defaultssid_regex = ^C Spire 4G LTE Hotspot [A-F0-9]{4}$ |default_ch = |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = |tpfirmware = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 10/11/2012 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = Thailand |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Atheros;AR9331; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== *the '''[[Qualcomm]]''' MDM9615 Gobi baseband ([http://theiphonewiki.com/wiki/MDM9615 on the iPhone wiki]) *'''[[SK hynix]]''' Flash/RAM chip (H9DA4GH2GJAM?, CR4EM is visible on the package) *an '''[[Atheros]]''' (likely SDIO) 802.11 chip The device appears to be single-stream and limited to HT20 modes (max rate of 65Mbps). Per the FCC SAR report under the cellular bands,
*WiFi is not operated when connected to a computer’s USB port. *WiFi is operated when connected to the USB port of the AC USB adapter. *This is a USB Dongle. Therefore, there is no voice transmission. Per the FCC manual, the default SSID pattern is presumed to be '''C Spire 4G LTE Hotspot XXXX''' for [http://www.cspire.com/ '''C Spire'''] branded units (is this device sold by any other carriers?). :Moderate (52 entries as of 03/22/2013) '''WiGLE''' data for the SSID, F4:63:49 ('''Diffon Corporation''') OUI, last 4 chars are from the BSSID (upper case hex characters) ==See also== *[[Franklin 770]] • [https://forum.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=764701 U770] • USB ID: 1fac:0232 :''Franklin Wireless Corp.''
